The answers might be "SharePoint Server Publishing Infrastructure" and "SharePoint Server Publishing".
Managed Navigation with using a term set would be appropriate in this case.
https://docs.microsoft.com/ja-jp/sharepoint/administration/overview-of-managed-navigation#how-managed-navigation-works-in-sharepoint-server

To enable managed navigation for a non-publishing site, you must activate the SharePoint Server Publishing Infrastructure feature for the site collection, and activate the SharePoint Server Publishing feature for the site.

From <https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sharepoint/administration/overview-of-managed-navigation>

Requirement is: You need to configure site navigation to use a term set.

And yes metadata navigation is related!

Here are the commands:
Enable-SPFeature -Identity CustomTiles -Url http://web_app -Force
$w = Get-SPWebApplication http://web_app
$w.Properties.CustomTilesListHostUrl = "http://web_app url"
$w.Update()
More info: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/SharePoint/administration/custom-tiles-in-sharepoint-server-2016

The second answer might be wrong then.

In my opinion it should be "Get-SPWebApplication", because it refers to the web app. "GetSPWeb" refers to a SITE.
aggree to player1 get-spweb does not include the property.

Enable-SPFeature -Identity CustomTiles -Url http://web_app -Force
To ensure the feature is available, at the PowerShell command prompt, type the following commands:
